intro: Pelexia ocreatopsis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a conical shape. Pelexia ocreatopsis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
